bots

Class HumanBot

  • java.lang.Object
    • bots.Bot
      • bots.HumanBot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class HumanBot
extends Bot
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    The HumanBot is a Bot that is under human control and should only be used for test purposes (e.g. have a match with only two Bots - the one you are developing and this one - then move and fire this Bot to test the behaviours of your AI.)

    When adding this Bot to the Arena, be sure to include the command addKeyListener(Bots[n]); where i is the number of the HumanBot. Failure to do this will mean the Bot will not react to keypresses.
    Version:
    1.0 (March 3, 2011)
    Author:
    Sam Scott

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics g,
        int x,
        int y)
        Description copied from class: Bot
        Called when it is time to draw the Bot. Your Bot should be (mostly) within a circle inscribed inside a square with top left coordinates (x,y) and a size of RADIUS * 2. If you are using an image, just put null for the ImageObserver - the arena has some special features to make sure your images are loaded before you will use them.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Bot
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object to draw yourself on.
        x - The x location of the top left corner of the drawing area
        y - The y location of the top left corner of the drawing area

      • getMove

        public int getMove(BotInfo me,
          boolean shotOK,
          BotInfo[] liveBots,
          BotInfo[] deadBots,
          Bullet[] bullets)
        Description copied from class: Bot
        This method is called at every time step to find out what you want your Bot to do. The legal moves are defined in constants in the BattleBotArena class (UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, FIREUP, FIREDOWN, FIRELEFT, FIRERIGHT, STAY, SEND_MESSAGE).

        The FIRE moves cause a bullet to be created (if there are not too many of your bullets on the screen at the moment). Each bullet moves at speed set by the BULLET_SPEED constant in BattleBotArena.

        The UP, DOWN, LEFT, and RIGHT moves cause the bot to move BOT_SPEED pixels in the requested direction (BOT_SPEED is a constant in BattleBotArena). However, if this would cause a collision with any live or dead bot, or would move the Bot outside the playing area defined by TOP_EDGE, BOTTOM_EDGE, LEFT_EDGE, and RIGHT_EDGE, the move will not be allowed by the Arena.

        The SEND_MESSAGE move (if allowed by the Arena) will cause a call-back to this Bot's outgoingMessage() method, which should return the message you want the Bot to broadcast. This will be followed with a call to incomingMessage(String) which will be the echo of the broadcast message coming back to the Bot.
        Specified by:
        getMove in class Bot
        Parameters:
        me - A BotInfo object with all publicly available info about this Bot
        shotOK - True iff a FIRE move is currently allowed
        liveBots - An array of BotInfo objects for the other Bots currently in play
        deadBots - An array of BotInfo objects for the dead Bots littering the arena
        bullets - An array of all Bullet objects currently in play
        Returns:
        A legal move (use the constants defined in BattleBotArena)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Description copied from class: Bot
        This method will only be called once, just after your Bot is created, to set your name permanently for the entire match.
        Specified by:
        getName in class Bot
        Returns:
        The Bot's name

      • getTeamName

        public java.lang.String getTeamName()
        Description copied from class: Bot
        This method is called at every time step to find out what team you are currently on. Of course, there can only be one winner, but you can declare and change team allegiances throughout the match if you think anybody will care. Perhaps you can send coded broadcast message or invitation to other Bots to set up a temporary team...
        Specified by:
        getTeamName in class Bot
        Returns:
        The Bot's current team name

      • imageNames

        public java.lang.String[] imageNames()
        Description copied from class: Bot
        This is called by the arena at startup to find out what image names you want it to load for you. All images must be stored in the images folder of the project, but you only have to return their names (not their paths).

        PLEASE resize your images in an image manipulation program. They should be squares of size RADIUS * 2 so that they don't take up much memory.
        Specified by:
        imageNames in class Bot
        Returns:
        An array of image names you want the arena to load.

      • incomingMessage

        public void incomingMessage(int botNum,
                   java.lang.String msg)
        Description copied from class: Bot
        This is called whenever the referee or a Bot sends a broadcast message.
        Specified by:
        incomingMessage in class Bot
        Parameters:
        botNum - The ID of the Bot who sent the message, or BattleBotArena.SYSTEM_MSG if the message is from the referee.
        msg - The text of the message that was broadcast.

      • loadedImages

        public void loadedImages(java.awt.Image[] images)
        Description copied from class: Bot
        Once the arena has loaded your images (see imageNames()), it calls this method to pass you the images it has loaded for you. Store them and use them in your draw method.

        PLEASE resize your images in an image manipulation program. They should be squares of size RADIUS * 2 so that they don't take up much memory.

        CAREFUL: If you got the file names wrong, the image array might be null or contain null elements.
        Specified by:
        loadedImages in class Bot
        Parameters:
        images - The array of images (or null if there was a problem)

      • newRound

        public void newRound()
        Description copied from class: Bot
        This method is called at the beginning of each round. Use it to perform any initialization that you require when starting a new round.
        Specified by:
        newRound in class Bot

      • outgoingMessage

        public java.lang.String outgoingMessage()
        Description copied from class: Bot
        This is only called after you have requested a SEND_MESSAGE move (see the documentation for getMove()). However if you are already over your messaging cap, this method will not be called. Messages longer than 200 characters will be truncated by the arena before being broadcast, and messages will be further truncated to fit on the message area of the screen.
        Specified by:
        outgoingMessage in class Bot
        Returns:
        The message you want to broadcast
